channel.title: MoparScape / RSPS
channel.description:
I'm just wondering how its going on the Moparscape community in 2016.
Answer the poll to your liking.
[b]Enlighten me![/b]

item.title: MoparScape / RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:24, topic:554573”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=673494.msg4504256#msg4504256 date=1455296587]

459 was best 'scape

@Silab: wasn’t someone working on an arcanists private server a while back?

taharok and I both played with one for awhile but we couldn’t get it to function correctly we had been under the assumption that our deob although compilable may have stripped some code.
[/quote]thing1 has some complete caches around the 459 era.[/quote]

tbh I haven’t seen any complete 459, 46x or 474 since… ever
Either npc visuals aren’t updated in the 459s or its a 474 loading 317
Would be very interested if he felt like sharing them :o

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape / RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Berky-Scape Berky-Scape
item.description:
@Berky-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:4, topic:554573”][quote author=Berky-Scape link=topic=673494.msg4503353#msg4503353 date=1453991587]

There’s not an answer for “none”.

Also just referring to your dates you have up there, 317 wasn’t actually fully released until March 2004. From what I can remember the first phase of RS2 beta was released on 1st December 2003 (if my 9 year old memory serves me right because I remember I couldn’t wait for Christmas to play it on my laptop).

In all seriousness mate, no-one really cares or plays RSPS here anymore. Personally the best era for me is 474.

Thanks for mentioning 474, forgot to put that one in. Also for the 317’s date.
I personally think, that if there would be a decent RSPS without all the customs/payable extras people would be more likely to play (again).
[/quote]

No probs. Don’t get me wrong, I’m working on a server right now that’s going to be a “last dash” attempt where we either make it or don’t. In our 5 man team there’s more than 30 years of conjoined experience in RSPS, if we can’t do it I really doubt anyone can make it what it was again.

RSPS just don’t have the interest and buzz around them that they used to sadly![/quote]

I 100% agree with you.

Good luck with the RSPS you guys are building!

What I’ve basically learned is that the quality of the script / performance of the server isn’t as important as its gameplay. I mean it’s a must, but creating a certain environment for players to play is much more important.

With this poll I wanted to see what the majority of Mopar’s community is into, so I could make a start and put the server online and build on that instead of scripting it closed off from everyone else.

Progress has to be seen by its community.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape / RSPS
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Berky-Scape, post:3, topic:554573”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=673494.msg4503352#msg4503352 date=1453991025]
There’s not an answer for “none”.

Also just referring to your dates you have up there, 317 wasn’t actually fully released until March 2004. From what I can remember the first phase of RS2 beta was released on 1st December 2003 (if my 9 year old memory serves me right because I remember I couldn’t wait for Christmas to play it on my laptop).

In all seriousness mate, no-one really cares or plays RSPS here anymore. Personally the best era for me is 474.
[/quote]

Thanks for mentioning 474, forgot to put that one in. Also for the 317’s date.
I personally think, that if there would be a decent RSPS without all the customs/payable extras people would be more likely to play (again).[/quote]

No probs. Don’t get me wrong, I’m working on a server right now that’s going to be a “last dash” attempt where we either make it or don’t. In our 5 man team there’s more than 30 years of conjoined experience in RSPS, if we can’t do it I really doubt anyone can make it what it was again.

RSPS just don’t have the interest and buzz around them that they used to sadly!

Read full topic
